intro: Stenolobium huancabambae, commonly known as the Huancabamba stenolobium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a distinctive yellow or greenish hue. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
